About me

Education and Work History

  • 2012-2015: B.Eng Electrical and Electronic Engineer - North-West University

    I begin my journey in 2012 as a freshman, where I learned a lot through out my four years and finally gruaduating as an Electrical and Electronic Engineer

  • 2014: Research Project - SibanyeStillwater

    Vacation Project under the supervision of senior electrical engineer. The project entail the analysis of Eskom tariffs within all Sibanye Gold Operations. Eskom is South africa Electricity Supply Commision

  • 2016: Post-Graduate Engineer - SibanyeStillwater

    Curriculum development and teaching Mathematics/Science and Engineering subjects to artisans in training. Practical Exposure: Operation and Management of Plant,Project Management

  • 2017-2018: PGDip Business Management - North-West University

    The faculty of the NWU School of Business & Governance is therefore focused on combining theory and practice, in order to fully develop the strategic leadership potential of business managers.

  • 2018: TEFL Certificate - North-West University

    Teaching English as a Foreign Language (TEFL) refers to teaching the English language to students with different first languages.

  • 2018-2019: Teacher - PGA International High School Program

    Teaching the GAC(Global assessment program): General Science, Business Studies, ACT Writing preparation, ICT, TOEFL Speaking, AP History and Social Science

Teaching Method and Philosophy

Let me introduce you to my teaching style and philosopy.

Personal model

I believe it is important to implement blended teaching that match the best techniques with the appropriate learning scenarios and students in an adaptive format. The two methods I personally use is the demonstrator and facilitator method. The demonstrator retains the formal authority role by showing students what they need to know. The demonstrator is a lot like the lecturer, but their lessons include multimedia presentations, activities, and demonstrations. Facilitators promote self-learning and help students develop critical thinking skills and retain knowledge that leads to self-actualization.

Teaching Philosophy

I believe that every students is unique and that now one learns the same. It is therefore neccesary to create an environment where students can grow emotionally, mentally, socialy and physically. Students must be encouraged to take risks and be comfortable sharing their thoughts. Teaching is a life-long learning process and regardless of one's experience there is always room for improvement. Therefore I believe it is important to be open to changes and adapting different teaching methods and always improving. I lead by example and always make sure that my students is interested in my subject.
